workflow.name: Automate inventory management with Google Sheets & Gmail
workflow.description:
## ‚úÖ What problem does this workflow solve?

Managing inventory manually requires constant monitoring, manual purchase order creation, and back-and-forth communication with suppliers.  
This workflow automates the **entire inventory replenishment cycle** ‚Äî from detecting low-stock items to generating purchase orders and emailing suppliers automatically.  
It ensures accurate stock levels, reduces manual work, and prevents stockouts.

---

## üí° Main Use Cases

- üîç Identify low-stock items automatically based on thresholds  
- üìä Perform scheduled daily inventory checks  
- üßæ Auto-generate purchase orders for items that need replenishment  
- ‚úâÔ∏è Email purchase orders directly to suppliers  
- üìÑ Update Google Sheets with order and inventory tracking information  

---

## üß† How It Works ‚Äì Step-by-Step

### 1. ‚è∞ Scheduled Trigger  
The workflow runs automatically every day (or any chosen interval) to begin inventory checks without manual involvement.

---

### 2. üìâ Get Low-Stock Items  
Reads your Google Sheets inventory file to identify items where **current stock < minimum stock threshold**.

---

### 3. üßÆ Process Each Low-Stock Item  
For every item below the # Header 1threshold:
- Calculates the required order quantity  
- Generates purchase order details, including  
  - SKU / Item Name
  - Quantity Needed 
  - Supplier Email
  - Stock Levels

---

### 4. üîÄ Conditional Flow  
For each low-stock item:

#### **Purchase Order Actions**
- Creates a purchase order email using the generated details  
- Sends the PO automatically to the supplier via Gmail  
- Logs the PO entry in Google Sheets with:
  - Item Details  
  - Order Quantity  
  - Supplier  
  - Timestamp  
  - Status (‚ÄúPO Sent‚Äù)  

---

### 5. üì¢ Notifications  
Sends purchase order emails directly to suppliers.  
(Optional) Internal notifications (Slack/email) can be added for procurement visibility.

---

## üìä Logging & Reporting  
All actions ‚Äî PO creation, stock levels, supplier emails ‚Äî are written back to Google Sheets for complete auditability and reporting.

---

## üë§ Who can use this?

Perfect for:
- Retail & eCommerce businesses  
- Warehouse teams  
- Procurement & purchasing departments  
- Manufacturing operations  
- Any business managing physical inventory  

---

## üöÄ Benefits

- ‚è± Automated stock monitoring  
- üì¶ Prevents stockouts  
- ‚úâÔ∏è Eliminates manual PO creation  
- üìö Creates a complete audit trail  
- üß† Smart, rule-based reorder logic  

---

parameters.content:
## Collect Low stock products
- Code node checks product stock meets the minimum threshold or not.
- Email created based on new stock and product details.

## How it works
This workflow automates inventory procurement by checking stock levels daily, calculating reorder quantities, and sending purchase orders to suppliers via email while logging them to Google Sheets.

## Setup steps
1. Connect your Google Sheets account (use the sample sheet as template)
2. Connect your Gmail account for sending supplier emails
3. Update the Google Sheet document ID if using your own sheet
4. Adjust the schedule trigger timing as needed
5. Test with a few low-stock items before going live

## Data Processing
- If already record created then skip otherwise add new record in spreadsheets.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
